item.title: Free As In Freedom
item.description: Libre, not gratis. I won’t go into the specifics of Free Software in this article, if you would like to know more check the references at the bottom of the page. Freedom is non-negotiable Your freedom as a user is the most important aspect of the software that you use. A common phrase found online regarding services such as search engines and email service providers goes something like “if it’s free then you are the product”.

item.title: What does the Steam Deck mean?
item.description: Valve recently announced their latest hardware product, the Steam Deck. A handheld “gaming PC” similar in shape and function to a Nintendo Switch except it isn’t a locked down OS. In fact it will be running the new SteamOS which apparently is now based on Arch Linux as opposed to the previous Debian based attempts. A lot of Linux users are showing interest in the device, which is understandable given it is a unique product in the Linux space.

item.title: RSS is Based!
item.description: I recently started using Newsboat for RSS. Getting a proper RSS setup has been on my “cozy setup” checklist for a while. It didn’t take much time at all to get it working either. I previously just used browser plug-ins for this however this approach is terrible in practice. Now that I have a proper setup using Newsboat I can truly appreciate RSS feeds and I would recommend using them to anyone that wants to keep up to date with things without engaging with social media.

item.title: Learning German
item.description: I have decided to learn German. I have always had an interest in learning another language but due to the terrible methodology used by the education system and cringe meme apps like DuoLingo I was never motivated enough to stick them out. However I recently came to discover the Michel Thomas method after reading these articles by Luke Smith: Notes on Learning Languages and Learning European Languages (Michel Thomas). I won’t bother to sumamrize them here but you should definetely read them if you are interested in learning a language.

item.title: Video Games Are Over
item.description: Introduction: Modern video games are an industrialised product that satisfies checklists at the cost of a unique identity and product. They are deceptively marketted and maliciously monetized. Occasionally a video game will come out that is just trying to be a fun video game. These are few and far between. This is not a nostalgia post, modern video games are genuinely terrible. Why do they suck? The simple answer and the correct one is: money.
